snippet: The projects in Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal face numerous hurdles before they can become a part of New York’s landscape and shoreline, officials and experts said.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's $20 billion program to protect New York City against climate change over next decade includes extensive details, down to the size of concrete bulkheads proposed for Queens; mayor is being praised for his foresight, but projects themselves face numerous obstacles before they could even be started, including the securing of billions of dollars in financing.
lead_paragraph: The projects in Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal face numerous hurdles before they can become a part of New York’s landscape and shoreline, officials and experts said.

headline.main: Bloomberg Storm Plan Praised, but Faces Obstacles
headline.print_headline: Mayor Praised for Storm-Protection Plan, but Obstacles Stand in Its Way
